properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 9 at 10:07AM CST until January 13 at 3:49PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a
flood warning for the following rivers in Illinois...

Skillet Fork River at Wayne City

.Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 3 days, with the highest
amounts expected Friday night into Saturday. River levels are forecast
to rise quickly along the Skillet Fork River at Wayne City, going above
flood stage on Saturday, and cresting in moderate flood level around 19.5
feet on Sunday. Stay tuned to later forecasts as the forecast crest will
likely fluctuate some depending on exactly how much and where the heaviest
rainfall axis ends up.

The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Skillet Fork River at Wayne City.
* from Saturday afternoon to Monday afternoon.
* At  9:00 AM Thursday the stage was 5.6 feet.
* Flood Stage is 15.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Saturday afternoon and
continue to rise to near 19.5 feet by Sunday early afternoon.
The river is forecast to fall below flood stage on Monday
afternoon.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
